title: Dianne Buswell debuts short hair after chopping off luscious locks post Strictly exit
text:
Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Pro dancer Dianne Buswell , 30, has embraced a shock change following her and DJ Dev's devastating Strictly Come Dancing departure.

The fiery redhead took to Instagram on Sunday to debut her fresh new hairstyle after she was dramatically booted off the BBC dancing competition with her celebrity partner.

Dianne shared a glamorous selfie showing off her new short, choppy hairstyle and straight bob-inspired style.

(Image: Instagram)

She asked her 819K followers: "Right serious question now!!! What do we think of the short hair?"

The dancer sent fans wild with her new look as her Instagram post was instantly flooded with compliments.

One fan replied: "LOVE. IT. SO. MUCH. It looks amazing Dianne!"

While another shared: "Prefer it short! Wow stunning."

A third posted: "You look gorgeous with short hair."

(Image: Instagram)

While Dianne chose to keep her statement red shade, the sophisticated new haircut is a stark difference to her usual luscious long locks.

The professional Latin and Ballroom dancer's shock appearance change comes after her recent Strictly exit.

Dianne and Dev Griffin left Strictly Come Dancing last weekend after their red-themed Cha Cha, and became the third couple to leave the show.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Dev and Dianne looked unable to contain their disappointment and emotions as they embraced in a hug.

Dianne, who was a finalist on Strictly Come Dancing last year with her now-boyfriend Joe Sugg , appeared close to tears as her hopes of winning the glitterball trophy came crashing down.

Dianne was so upset by the decision, she pulled out of appearing on the show's podcast with her boyfriend Joe after filming wrapped.

During an appearance on BBC2 spin-off It Takes Two last week, the red-head said she hopes it's not over for Dev and she'll continue teaching him if he wants to continue to learn to dance.

"I'm just really, really sad it's over," Dianne told co-host Rylan Clark-Neal.

Dianne's obvious sadness comes after the dancer was forced to take to Twitter to plead trolls to stop sending death threats to head judge Shirley Ballas , after she received blame for the couple's Strictly exit.

*Strictly Come Dancing returns next Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One
description: The professional dancer has stunned fans with her post-Strictly long bob and stylish new hairstyle
